alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 12:33PM CDT until April 19 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt will continue on the Nemadji River. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following area, Douglas county. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding on the Nemadji River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1228 PM CDT, The Nemadji River will continue to slowly rise as snow melt runoff makes its way into the river. At the gage located at County Highway C, the river may approach a level of 25.5 feet today and remain near this level through the weekend. - At a level of 23.5 feet, the water level is near the bottom of the County Highway C Bridge. A large area of backwater also forms upstream of the bridge at this level. Debris jamming under the bridge is possible. At a level of 26 feet, water encroaches a house west of the Nemadji River on County Road C. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Locations along the Nemadji River in Douglas county. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
